SENT.plain: We describe a patient with pseudotumor cerebri for which a lumboperitoneal (LP) shunt was placed
After a pseudomeningocele was noted at the lumbar incision site, an LP shunt revision was done, at which time migration of the catheter into the thecal sac was noted
Three months later, radiologic studies revealed cranial migration of the LP shunt into the posterior fossa
We believe no similar complication has been reported
